Part 1 of 2I saw a job opening for a Chauffeur that pays \displaystyle\${51},{000} per year salary. Assume that a regular work week for this job is \displaystyle{40} hours, and that you will work \displaystyle{48} weeks in a year.
What is the hourly pay for this job? We will answer the question by converting 51,000 per year into dollars per hour.
If we begin with the fraction \displaystyle\frac{{\${51000}}}{\text{year}}, we can multiply by two unit fractions to complete the conversion. What are these fractions? Choose the correct fractions in the calculation below:
\displaystyle\frac{{\${51000}}}{\text{year}}\times
48 weeks/1 year
1 week / 48 years
1 year/48 weeks
48 years/1 week
\displaystyle\times
1 hour/40 weeks
1 week/40 hours
40 hours/1 week
40 weeks/1 hour
Part 2 of 2 Finally, what is the hourly pay for this job?
Hourly pay = dollars/hour
myopenmath.solution:
C: 1 year/48 weeks
B: 1 week/40 hours
26.56
For this job, we know the following conversion facts:
1 year = 51000 dollars
1 year = 48 weeks
1 week = 40 hours
So, we can convert the yearly rate of 51,000 per year into dollars per hour by the following calculation:
\displaystyle\frac{{\${51000}}}{{\color{red}\cancel{{\text{year}}}}}\cdot\frac{{{1}\ {\color{red}\cancel{{\text{year}}}}}}{{{48}\ {\color{blue}\cancel{{\text{weeks}}}}}}\cdot\frac{{{1}\ {\color{blue}\cancel{{\text{week}}}}}}{{{40}\ \text{hours}}}=\frac{{\${51000}\cdot{1}\cdot{1}}}{{{1}\cdot{48}\cdot{40}\ \text{hours}}}
\displaystyle\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \approx{26.56}\frac{\text{\$}}{\text{hour}}
So, the position pays \displaystyle{26.56} dollars/hour.
